title: How to Earn a Catalog Badge in Animal Crossing: New Leaf

steps.headline: Look at the Collector Badge.
steps.description:
You'll need to complete a certain percentage of your catalog, such as clothing, tools, furniture, and fossils. Bronze rank: Complete 20% of the catalog
Silver rank: Complete 50% of the catalog
Gold rank: Complete 80% of the catalog

steps.headline: Accomplish the minimum amount required.
steps.description: There is a few ways to do it. Buy stuff, accept gifts from villagers or you can go to a friends town and pick up items of their ground and put them back down again.

steps.headline: Locate Phineas.
steps.description: When a player achieves the minimum for a level, Phineas will appear somewhere in town on clear days.

steps.headline: Talk to him.
steps.description: At times, he'll give you multiple badges, so just keep pressing buttons.

steps.headline: View your badge on your Town Pass Card.
steps.description: Learn that ranks override each other, so if you achieve a bronze, a silver one will override it instead of showing both ranks.

text:
Look at the Collector Badge. You'll need to complete a certain percentage of your catalog, such as clothing, tools, furniture, and fossils. Bronze rank: Complete 20% of the catalog
Silver rank: Complete 50% of the catalog
Gold rank: Complete 80% of the catalog Accomplish the minimum amount required. There is a few ways to do it. Buy stuff, accept gifts from villagers or you can go to a friends town and pick up items of their ground and put them back down again. Locate Phineas. When a player achieves the minimum for a level, Phineas will appear somewhere in town on clear days. Talk to him. At times, he'll give you multiple badges, so just keep pressing buttons. View your badge on your Town Pass Card. Learn that ranks override each other, so if you achieve a bronze, a silver one will override it instead of showing both ranks.
